7a72171ea553dcfe19249e5b69d3312d (19:20): i'm trying to use float's and getting into a real mess
3e853e610b14db14c2ea8f1d026cc8e4 (19:21): well, now it works cheater cause i have appllied the border-bottom to each <td>, i would have prefered to only apply the style to the <tr>
3e853e610b14db14c2ea8f1d026cc8e4 (19:21): you know a working method for IE ?
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:21): i think IE doesn't inherit border-bottom
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:21): and a row itself doesn't have a border afaik
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:21): `css border-bottom
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (19:21): css border-bottom: http://w3.org/TR/CSS21/box.html#propdef-border-bottom
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:22): Applies to:   all elements
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:22): `css border-collapse
3e853e610b14db14c2ea8f1d026cc8e4 (19:22): it should work on IE, but it doesn't
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (19:22): css border-collapse: http://w3.org/TR/CSS21/tables.html#propdef-border-collapse
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:28): read 17.6.2.1 http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/tables.html
3e853e610b14db14c2ea8f1d026cc8e4 (19:45): i've seen that already cheater the border-bottom should work on IE on a <tr>, but it doesn't, w3 doesn't help
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:46): IE doesn't do it right. It should, and does in Moz and such, with border-collapse: collapse; set on the row's table element.
3e853e610b14db14c2ea8f1d026cc8e4 (19:47): so ther's no way ?
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:49): try setting the TRs border to "none"
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:49): the TDs border to "none" and the TRs border to solid
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:53): that should work and may work in ie
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:53): no idea if it will

8cbdeba9587dc3d2680e110ce776b3f5 (19:53): hi all - i am trying to use <li> elements for a menu item - i have removed the style so no dot but they are still appearing tabbed in - what is the best way to get them back left - use negative padding
8cbdeba9587dc3d2680e110ce776b3f5 (19:54): cheater: by default there is no margin
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:54): nickthorley: Remove margin and padding from li and ul/ol.
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:54): have you even *tried* it?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:54): There will be margin or padding on li and/or ul/ol. It varies between browsers, but there's usually something on both.
8cbdeba9587dc3d2680e110ce776b3f5 (19:55): boat: i dont have either but still tabbed in
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:55): You need to set it to zero. The default is not zero.
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:56): And if it's zero and there's still space, then start debugging. Put some borders on things and see where the space is.
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (19:56): If they're inline (and have no margin or padding), then it might be whitespace in the source.
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:57): `css list-style-position
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (19:57): css list-style-position: http://w3.org/TR/CSS21/generate.html#propdef-list-style-position
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:57): might be what you're looking for
8cbdeba9587dc3d2680e110ce776b3f5 (20:03): b0at: that worked fine - thanks
8cbdeba9587dc3d2680e110ce776b3f5 (20:03): cheater: thanks also

8a3baba97ec51277ed8ac64e456f6027 (20:08): Hmmm... According to the validator, you need to put an inner level of <ul> inside an existing <li>, not directly inside an <ul>.  Anyone know how this can be made to not look like crap in MSIE?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (20:08): Yes, ul can only have li children and li can only be children of ul or ol...
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (20:09): What makes it look bad? Padding and margin?
